fields.description:
It is not a regression.It exists as far as 1.8.2

While packaging the app,when the value of ti.ui.defaultunit is 'abc' -
Expected - Display warning during packaging, use default system value
Actual - No warnings are displayed while packaging.

Logs generated while packaging are attached with the bug.
fields.summary: Android: Packaging:No warning displayed for default system value of 'ti.ui.defaultunit'.
fields.environment:
Tested with Titanium SDK: 2.1.0.v20120619164153
Tested with Titanium Â Studio: 2.1.0.201206200844
Device - Android 2.2.2 LG-P970
Machine OS - MAC 10.7.3

comments.body:
Valid default units include:

* system
* px
* dp
* dip
* mm
* cm
* in

The following are unsupported:

* sp
* sip
* pt
* %

Here's the full list of Android's units: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/resources/more-resources.html#Dimension.

Warning is displayed for default system value of 'ti.ui.defaultunit' as 
" [ERROR] :  Invalid "ti.ui.defaultunit" property value "abc"
Valid units:
  system
  px
  dp
  dip
  mm
  cm
  in
"

Works as expected hence closing the issue.

Verified fixed on:
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.2.0.201311112306
SDK:3.2.0.v20131111174605
alloy: 1.3.0
CLI : 3.2.0
Xcode:5.0.1
OS: Mac OSX 10.9
